intro: Habranthus pedunculosus, commonly known as the slender starflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
